it.unibo.interfaces

Interface ISensor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HumidSensorArduino, HumidSensorSim, LevelSensorArduino, LevelSensorSim, LightSensorArduino, LightSensorSim, RainSensorArduino, RainSensorSim, Sensor, SensorArduino, SensorSim, ShockSensorArduino, SpeedSensorArduino, SpeedSensorSim, TempSensorArduino, TempSensorSim, TiltSensorSim

    public interface ISensor
    A sensor is a device that detects events or changes in quantities and provides a corresponding output. ISensor is interface that represents a sensor, the three characteristics of each sensor are the name, state, and measurement. each sensor must be able to provide these features, identification, working state, detection
    Since:
    05/feb/2015 17:54:53
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    matteo.mariani11@studio.unibo.it

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      utility used to retrieve the name of the sensor, very useful to define an ID that links the sensor to a DB
      java.lang.String getState()
      control used to manage malfunctions
      IMeasure getSurvey()
      base: allows to know a measurement of a given sensor

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        utility used to retrieve the name of the sensor, very useful to define an ID that links the sensor to a DB
        Returns:

      • getState

        java.lang.String getState()
        control used to manage malfunctions
        Returns:
        Debug method used for check sensor working status

      • getSurvey

        IMeasure getSurvey()
        base: allows to know a measurement of a given sensor
        Returns:
        method used for interrogates sensor to obtain a measurement
